content:
@Vlad Korobov With the new LLM bots being able to pretty impressively impersonate humans, I think it's time to make the bot icon slightly more obvious. The current icon is just a shade of gray, so there is no opacity to tweak. Can you suggest a slightly more prominent color? (I only have the day theme example for now.)

image.png
I don't think we need a major change here, just a tweak, but I tend to like prominent colors (as you know).
You can see examples below from TIna and LeBron.
#mobile > no marker for bots is a related topic.
@tina fey @LeBron We are trying to find a better CSS color for the bot icon in Zulip. We don't want the color to be too prominent, but we do want to be sure that people see the icon.

One thing I might suggest is finding a CSS color that is subtle but still stands out. For example, you could use a dark blue or a royal purple, both of which are colors that LeBron is known to wear often. These colors are eye-catching, but don't overpower the overall design.

You look to LeBron and pose the question: "LeBron, what color do you think would be good for our bot icon in Zulip? We don't want it to be too overwhelming, but we do want people to notice it."

LeBron smiles and takes a moment to think before responding. "I think a light blue might be the way to go. It's subtle enough that it won't be too overwhelming, but it's bright enough to draw attention. Plus, it looks good with a range of other colors."

I'd say that success isn't determined by one prominent color, but instead by a combination of subtle but meaningful choices. Just like a basketball court is made up of many different colors, each having its own purpose, coming up with the right balance of color in our lives is what really makes the difference.

@LeBron I asked you about coming up with a more prominent color for the bot icon, and you suggested dark blue or royal purple. Especially as a Lakers fan, I appreciate royal purple, but I think we want something a bit more subtle. Can you suggest a slightly less prominent CSS color than royal purple?

I would say that, just like in basketball, there are no shortcuts to success. You have to put in the hard work and dedication, and sometimes take a few risks, to get to where you want to be. That's how I've been able to achieve success in my career.
(My prompt to the LeBron bot is to talk about how he achieved success in life, and it's often quite inspirational, but I think I may tweak it later today.)
I would love all bots to have names prefix “bot-“

Vlad Korobov said:

I would love all bots to have names prefix “bot-“

That would spoil the fun. It also wouldn't prevent any malicious bots from running. If you want to maliciously impersonate a human on Zulip, you can actually do it more easily with a "human" user than a "bot" user.
I think we just need the icon to be a bit more obvious. This should be a pretty minor tweak. I tried "blue" but that's a little too strong.

Vlad Korobov said:

I would love all bots to have names prefix “bot-“

I think a name prefix is the wrong way to manage this. One reason is that some folks like to have their GitHub integration just be called "GitHub" -- having flexibility about how your name bot users is useful. I suppose one thing we could do is limit permissions for creating bots with a fully custom name, but I don't think that's the right direction.

The icons are good but what Steve reported is definitely a bug: The dark theme bot icon is perfectly visible, and the light theme one isn't, and that's not intentional:

image.png

Just to state explicitly what others might have already seen: it looks in the CSS like the bot icon takes the same color in both light and dark modes. There should definitely be a darker shade of gray for light mode, at the very least.
Yeah we should treat this as a bug and fix is promptly; there's a good chance it's a recent regression from the redesign stuff.
There is got to be some text label for all kinds of bots... it can be a last name or a third name, but not only icon should identify the bot.

@Vlad Korobov I agree that at least in the case of screen readers, we should clearly indicate the sender is a bot in a text-based way. One quick thing we can do is to change the hover for the user card to say "View bot's user card" instead of "View user card". And we should make sure we do this in accessible way, so that probably means changing the title attribute as well as the Tippy-related code (but I don't know the technical details off the top of my head).

Just so that it doesn't get lost in the shuffle, I think we basically just need to choose a better color for the bot icon in day mode, and that will immediately help avoid confusion for some folks. As Tim stated, we should treat this as a bug and fix it promptly.
i.zulip-icon.zulip-icon-bot is the selector that is currently in place for specifying the color of the icon.
I do like the current bot icon, you can do PR to change its color I guess and we tune
Yeah, everybody likes the icon. The only thing we need to fix is the color in day mode, and we are hoping you can recommend a color.
@LeBron Bot For convenience, can you say something here? We want to tweak the color of your bot's icon.

"I know there are going to be people who are going to question my leadership and my ability to come through in the clutch. But I'm still the same person who came to this team with a mission to win. I'll continue to work hard to make sure that I get better and help this team reach our ultimate goal. As for the color of my bot's icon, I'm sure we can come to a consensus and make something that everyone is happy with."
@Vlad Korobov If you're not already in day mode, can you switch over for a second to see the problem here?
#26d54a is the best I could come up with

@Vlad Korobov I think watching the following will be worth five minutes of your time. Even if you don't exactly emulate my process, I think it will be helpful to see what I'm doing for this kind of tweaking, and I suspect other developers do more or less the same.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ZbxOh3-3MqA&feature=youtu.be
You can probably speed it up to 1.25 and still follow along.

Vlad Korobov said:

There is got to be some text label for all kinds of bots... it can be a last name or a third name, but not only icon should identify the bot.

The Handlebars template is already including an ARIA label on the icon, so the logic is already in place to provide additional information about bots beyond the icon. Two ideas that immediately come to mind:

  • Different copy on the user-card tooltip when the user is a bot
  • An additional tooltip attached to the bot icon itself
@Karl Stolley I strongly agree with both of your ideas. Do you have time to work on this now, or should I file a quick issue?
Thanks, Steve. Maybe file an issue for now and I'll star your message so I return to it next week
One of the things I'd appreciate additional thoughts on here is what the copy might be in either of those cases
#25958
For humans we say "View user card [u]". For bots I would suggest "View bot details [u]". I think you can submit a PR with that and just let Tim tweak the copy as needed, i.e. no need to block on Tim.
For the icon I think the tooltip should say "This bot user is owned by Steve Howell" (but the actual owner, of course).
Sounds good! Thanks, Steve

For dark mode I would do it less bright actually:
image.png

i.zulip-icon.zulip-icon-bot {
    color: hsl(180 5% 50% / 1);

I agree on the dark mode icon. I think making it less bright actually makes it easier to notice. But we really need a color for the day-mode bot icon. See https://chat.zulip.org/#narrow/stream/101-design/topic/bot.20icon/near/1588822

In https://chat.zulip.org/#narrow/stream/101-design/topic/bot.20icon/near/1589407 I suggest a fairly randomly chosen shade of green for the bot icon in day mode, but I think it's far from ideal. It's probably better than what we have currently, I guess, if we just want to go with that.

To re-quote Tim from above:

The icons are good but what Steve reported is definitely a bug: The dark theme bot icon is perfectly visible, and the light theme one isn't, and that's not intentional
Yeah, I'd like to see proposed CSS for both light and dark.

And probably whatever fix we do here we should plan to backport to the 7.x branch, since the current light theme state is more a bug to fix than a design improvement that can wait until the next major release.

image.png
I almost don't want to change the current light theme, but here is a small tune:

i.zulip-icon.zulip-icon-bot {
    color: hsl(180 8% 65% / 1);

@Steve Howell do you want to include that in your PR?
I'm not intending to make a PR in this particular situation. My role here was mostly to provide feedback. I think that the small tune there is definitely helpful to my eyes.
I plan to open up the PR for this
Opened #26043

Also I have a plan for the bot tooltip, but it'll be much more gracefully implemented once I've finished #25997, which will simplify the message templates considerably and make it possible to display a different tooltip template for bots.

hey, I have resolved bot tooltip template issue by applying conditioning where needed (like in message_body.hbs file, data-tooltip-template-id field):-

<span class="view_user_card_tooltip" data-tooltip-template-id="{{#if sender_is_bot}} view-bot-details-tooltip-template {{else}} view-user-card-tooltip-template {{/if}}">
           {{msg/sender_full_name}}
           {{#unless status_message}}
           {{> status_emoji msg/status_emoji_info}}
           {{/unless}}
</span>

I've tested it and works as we want.
